top_comment.text:
This is kind of random, but my hair is naturally wavy, but I like it 
straight better. So do you have any tips for how to get straight hair, 
without a straightening iron?﻿
top_comment.author: Emily Kniskern

comments.text:
I brush really straight en put some product in it en brush is straight but 
it's not really straight but not wavy either
comments.author: Lianne Jerina

comments.text:
After you get out of the shower and your hair is wet get a comb or brush 
that has like an open back and put your blow dryer on the cold setting. Or 
go watch glitterforever17 straight hair with no heat.

top_comment.text:
I'm a swimmer and I have a swim cap and afterward my hair is a mess and 
hard to brush. Are there anyways to put your hair in under your swim cap 
(besides a bun) that would look cute after taking it off?﻿
top_comment.author: JJRainbowPeaches

comments.text: thanks:)
comments.author: Lion512

comments.text:
Wet your hair before you get in the chlorine water, that way your hair 
soaks up fresh water and not as much chlorine :)
comments.author: Hannah Feldstein

comments.text:
I wear my hair in two normal plaits and then put them on my head when I'm 
putting my cap on but another good one is to stick your hair into two high 
ponies on wait her side of your head then plait them then put them into buns
comments.author: Bridget Flynn

comments.text:
Put a tiny bit of baby powder in the cap and its easier to take off
But dont put too much or u will look like a granny
Lol
I put my hair in a very tight braid or fishtail and it turns out fine
Just make sure u have a brush or comb with u tho
Just incase
comments.author: Iman Tai

comments.text:
I am a swimmer:) I wear my hair in a bun and it does not seem
To get tangled! But it probably depends on the type of hair
comments.author: Lion512

comments.text: Thanks!
comments.author: JJRainbowPeaches

comments.text:
+camcat26
That's what I did in high school. Make sure it's a swimmer's conditioner 
though so it works even better
comments.author: Cheyenne Kemp (Shay's fit life)

comments.text: Line your swim cap with conditioner. It will cut down on chlorine damage
comments.author: camcat26

comments.text:
I would recommend a tight French Braid and then put the rest of the braid 
into a bun...you should have a cute wavy beachy look!!
comments.author: Sarah Grace

top_comment.text:
Hi Mindy , and anyone else who wants to help me! I'm just asking a 
suggestion for a hair style. So I am doing hair for our whole school play 
of  ' The sound of music" and I am doing Maria's hair in milkmaid braids. I 
was just wondering if you had any suggestions of how I could make sure it 
stays in while she is moving and dancing and stuff... Got any ideas? Thanks 
heaps , Oh and by the way thank you so much for all the hair tutorials you 
have put up every week for ages! They have been so good to watch and I love 
them! :-) ﻿
top_comment.author: Georgia Kri

comments.text: idk if this would work but, you could try goody spin pins
comments.author: 5hillfam <3

comments.text:
Tons of bobby pins in top and bottom of both braids shopuld hold it in 
pretty well. Hope this helps. It can never b too secure. LOL
comments.author: HairStylist 2014

comments.text:
Hair glue or hair wax! When I did school productions of Alice In Wonderland 
and Bugsy Malone in the last two years, we used them (and hairspray for 
smaller roles) and it worked so well ^_^
comments.author: KatiesInfinity

comments.text: +Zara Awramenko Of*
comments.author: Zara Awramenko

comments.text:
Put lots or hairspray in it and lots of bobby pins. I think that should 
work :D

comments.text:
Good hairstyles are 2 braids on either side of your hair, and side braid, 
and simple French braid. I would advise(if you have bangs) to pull them off 
of your face because he oils in your hairs can mix and combine with the 
oils on your face and cause acne. Just a fun little fact of the day!! 😃

captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

-Hey everyone, I'm Mindy
from CuteGirlsHairstyles.

And today Brooklyn is
going to help me out
from BrooklynAndBailey.
-Hi guys.

-And we're going to show you how
to do the running braid combo.

So I saw this picture
pop up in my Instagram
feed from Lululemon.

And you guys are always
asking me for hairstyles

that you can wear if you're
doing athletics, you know,

that are still cute but pulled
back and out of your face.

So this one, I knew,
needed a tutorial.

So we're going to film this
one for you guys today.

So we have just started by
Brooklyn washed her hair
and slept on it last night.

So that it was nice
and clean but we
haven't done anything with it.

And I'm going to begin a
regular French braid right here
at the top.

Right just at the
top of her forehead.

And just to begin we're going
to run a basic French braid
down the top of her head.

And we are going to pick up
hair all the way pretty much
to her ears.
So this is pretty basic.
Just a french braid.

You could even do a dutch
braid if you really wanted to,

if that's the one
you're more comfortable
with than a French braid.
That's fine too.

Now I'm going to continue
the braid all the way down.

Just all the way
to the very ends.

Get that piece of
hair out of there.

And when I get to
the end, I'm going
to secure it with an elastic.

And just for the sake
of doing my next step,

I'm going to take
this and just flip it

up and over so it's
out of the way.

Now I'm going to take
the rest of her hair

and I'm going to pull it
up into a ponytail right
where the braid ends.
So you can just use a comb.

You can use some water or some
hairspray if you need too.

On Brooklyn, she had a
lot a little fuzzies.

So I'm actually going to just
spritz a little bit of hair wax

through it to help kind of
tame some of that flyway issue
for her.

OK and when you have that pulled
where you pretty much want it,

then I'm going to add this
hair back in and secure it

all together in one
pony tail elastic.

Just make sure you
have all your pieces
where you want them laying.
Into a nice, high ponytail.
Oh, she's got so much hair.
-Barely getting it around.
-I know.
That elastic was tight too.
OK.

So now we have the one braid
and the remaining hair.

I'm going to take the braid
again and flip it on top.

And I'm going to divide the
rest of this section of hair

into three pieces, just
pretty much even pieces.

And then you're going to
braid each of those sections.

When you're done braiding
those three sections,

go ahead and pull that
fourth braid back down in.

And I'm just going to split
two braids in my right hand
and two braids in my left.

And I'm going to just take
them and twist them together
all the way down.

And then when you
get to the end,

secure it with and
elastic all together.
Oh!
That elastic did not last.
-My hair's too thick.
-Secure them all together.

And then you can even go
back and pull out the others

if you'd like since you have
it nicely secured together now.

And then just let it loosen
up a bit and sit like this.
And you have the running braid.
Let's do a final spin.

It's just a great
little French straight
into a ponytail of braids.

Would you wear that to
your dance class, Brooklyn?
-Definitely.

-She has dance every
day at school this year.
-It would stay in really well.
It'd be perfect.

-Keep it out of
your face, anyway.
-Yeah.

-And if you're all
sweaty or gross--

-It doesn't look that
bad because it's already
in a ponytail.
-That's right.
Perfect.

OK, so if you guys want to
see some really old pictures

of Brooklyn and
our hairstyles, be

sure to check us
out on Facebook.

Be sure to give us
a like over there.
-Follow us on Facebook.

-We'll put a link in the
description box below.

You can find it at
CuteGirlsHairstyles, of course.

And we will see you
guys next Sunday.
Bye you guys.
-Bye!
[MUSIC PLAYING]

-Wait, tell her what
you're so excited about.
-School.

-Your first day of
preschool right now.
Are we going right now?
-Mhm.
-OK, let's go.
-Yay!

title: The Run Braid Combo | Hairstyles for Sports
